About

WHO I AM

ABOUT

Hi! I'm Hazel Wong

I'm a senior at the University of Michigan, majoring in Computer Science and minoring in Chemistry. After taking a course on Computer Game Design and Development, I had developed a strong interest in game design.


Since January 2020, I have been working with Unity and C# to build a variety of different games. I joined a student-led gamedev team of five named MacroHard Studio, and together, we made Back 2 Back, which won first place in a 48-hour game jam, and Yolked, which won first place in the Student Virtual Games Showcase hosted by the University of Michigan and Eastern Michigan University. In addition, we've also showcased Yolked at the Student Games Festival, hosted by the SGDA. We decided to continue working on Yolked during the summer with the goal of publishing the game on Steam.


In the summers of 2019 and 2020, I've also had internships with Datatech Global HK and Animoca Brands, where I developed skills in front-end web development.


Outside of the academic world, I was the President of the Cooking Club at the University of Michigan from 2018-2020, an organization that hosted bi-weekly cooking events for undergraduate and graduate students. The goal of the events was to create an inclusive social space and non-competitive learning environment for students to learn how to cook tasty, nutritious dishes.

My Resume

Experience

  • Animoca Brands

    • Developed public-facing websites for video games using HTML, CSS and React Native

    • Transformed XD files made by graphic designers into webpages

    • Reworked and fixed bugs of existing webpages

    • Created responsive webpages for mobile, tablet and desktop

    • Integrated a part of an API flow between a website and a game client

  • Explore CS Research Program

    • Directly engaged in research with a professor to explore prediction biases of recidivism prediction instruments and to replicate the results of a specific dataset

    • Got accepted to present our results at the virtual Grace Hopper Conference in Oct 2020

  • The Frank Research Group

    • Utilized quantum mechanical computational methods to predict substrate ligand binding in biological systems and calculate energy differences of different molecular structures

    • Coded and ran shell scripts to read in RNA molecules, break molecules into fragments and compute the chemical properties of each fragment

  • Datatech Global HK

    • Created simple animations on a responsive website using HTML, CSS and jQuery to enhance an exhibition showcase experience

    • Designed and built a functional content management system with Javascript, React and MySQL for a mobile application with functions such as adding, deleting, editing, and keyword searching

    • Developed a new enrollment system flow for an English learning centre, including the specifications of the backend and frontend systems in a functional requirement document

My Projects

Latest Work

My Projects

  • Yolked (WIP)
    Five months into development by a team of three, Yolked! is a single-player, action-adventure that follows the excruciating journey of an egg as it uses its human arms to make its way across the kitchen. Yolked! won first place at the EECS 494 + EMU Student Virtual Games Showcase.
  • Back 2 Back
    Completed in two days by a team of five, Back 2 Back is an action, shooter game, where the player must control two characters facing back to back in order to kill/avoid all incoming enemies. Back 2 Back won first place at the Wolverine Soft Game Jam at the University of Michigan.
  • Color Array
    Completed in two weeks, Color Array is a rapid prototype of an original puzzle platformer game with a simple color-changing mechanic.
  • Legend of Zelda (Unity Remastered)
    Completed in three weeks by a team of two, this Unity Remastered version of Legend of Zelda contains the first dungeon of the original NES game.
